result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xiomara Santiago

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xiomara Santiago in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Xiomara Santiago.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea Hearing.  Court advised parties are still attempting to locate a monitoring agency near the Defendant's place of residence.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter for plea hearing, with possible DPA.  Defendant is allowed to appear via zoom if needed.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Xiomara Santiago in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Xiomara Santiago.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing with possible DPA.  Parties unable to proceed with Plea/DPA until monitoring organization in the County of residence is located.  Defendant given approval to appear via zoom for next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Xiomara Santiago in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attorney Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pre-trial Conference. Discussion held regarding possible Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Defense requests Plea hearing be scheduled.

Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Xiomara Santiago in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following filing deadlines. The State has until June 13th, 2022, to submit any discovery to the defense. Defense has until August 5th, 2022, to file any motions or change of plea forms. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-2-2022

22RM026735  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/21/2022 sa

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Court rescheduled the scheduling conference with the parties. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Xiomara Santiago in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Xiomara Santiago in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xiomara Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Xiomara Santiago in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Xiomara Santiago in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xiomara Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
